add_noise.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 %%
00002 %! @file
00003 % Add noise to the image.
00004 %
00005 
00006 %! Add gaussian noise to the image. Assumes the exposure is long enough that central limit theorem is valid. (Short exposure is currently not supported)
00007 % 
00008 % Signal-to-noise ratio is estimated by the ratio ( @f$\frac{\mu}{\sigma} @f$ ), where @f$ \mu @f$ is the expected (perfect) measurement result, @f$ \sigma @f$ is the variance of the noise. In dB scale it is @f$ 20log_{10}(\frac{A_\textrm{noise}}{A_\textrm{noise}}) @f$ 
00009 %
00010 % @param image matrix of the image
00011 % @param SNRdB signal to noise ratio (1~inf)
00012 % @retval new_image new image loaded with noise
00013 
00014 function new_image = add_noise(image,SNRdB)
00015 
00016 [height width] = size(image);
00017 
00018 % estimate the variance of noise in each measurement of each sensor.
00019 SNR = 10^(SNRdB/20);
00020 signal_amplitude = mean(mean(image));
00021 variance = signal_amplitude / SNR;
00022 
00023 noise = randn(height,width) * variance;
00024 
00025 new_image = image + noise;
00026
